legacies:
Alone in this chilly city, with my useless education, and my dreams.

What now?
Endowed from birth with wealth and talent. A life of ease, comfort and delight stretches ahead like an amber carpet.
I missed the dawn. I generally do. There'll be plenty more.
As the patient descended into the final delirium, you made copious notes. In the buzzing heat of the night, you re-read those notes, and they began, at last, to make a kind of sense.
Today is the day I return to my post at the Institute. I have a position, and a reputation. That should mean something; but I am beginning to dream of something else.
At times, in mirrors, in crowds, you see the face of one now lost.

One morning, when the Sun is high and the mirrors all are sealed, there will come a knock on your door. "A benefactor", the gentleman in grey will say. "A bequest. Perhaps you hadn't known you were related."
